What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?

What's the right people structure for an IT Services company? Pyramid, Diamond or Cylindrical/Circular? Is there a learning for hashtag#GCCs from these? HCLTech's Vijayakumar C also weighs in.Was this an accident or deliberately designed? Let's decipher the dipstick into the Indian IT Services cohort to check the overall experience distribution and that of bellwether firms in the IT Services cohort (7 Tier 1 - Listed firms and 10 Midcap Listed firms)-The distribution does have a "big-fat-middle" layer. -Has the hyper-hiring phase in 2021-2022 contributed to a broad layer of junior talent falling into the 3 to 5-year bracket?- Also caused a wider mid-layer in the 5 to 9 and 9 to 13 Years of experience layers. -Are these also the layers where the highest churn occurred during the buoyancy? -We know that the average attrition of IT Services firms has hovered between 12-16% during this time.-Though the net addition of headcounts amongst these companies has gone to minus or negligible in the last year or so, the IT Services companies have continued to replace the skilled and experienced billers. But...-The 1 - 3 Years of Experience and Freshers have relatively shrunk due to the low intake of campus volumes in the last 3 intake cycles. What do these evolving Organograms tell us in the current context?
